fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29919].
  {panel}

Currently  @mention can only search user through their full name and not their user name.

In this example the user full name is *bla* and his username is *pop*
!example.png!

This user can only be found in @mention through *bla* and not *pop*
fields.summary: Allow @mention to search Username.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29916].
  {panel}

Hello,

I would like the ability for my clients to change their passwords in Confluence. It seems like there's no way to force password change or update once it has been created. As you know it's important to change password often so that the site/users are not prone to hackers or spammers. It's just seems to be a common feature to be able to change password. 

If not added in Confluence maybe have it part of Crowd. Where you point the clients back to Crowd and let them change it. Please give this a consideration when adding new features. Thank you for reading.

Hao Doan
fields.summary: Ability to change password

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29915].
  {panel}

*Steps To Reproduce*
# Watch a page.
# Get Mentioned in a Comment

*Expected Result*
Receive one email that you've been mentioned in a comment.

*Actual Result*
Received both an email that you've been mentioned in a comment AND that the page has been changed.
Check screenshots for example.
fields.summary: Receiving Multiple Notifications for the Same Comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29914].
  {panel}

Improvement request to attachments when creating a page for the first time.

Steps to reproduce:
Create page
In edit mode before having saved page, add attachments
No ability to remove attachment unless page is saved, then edit attachments.

There should be a mechanism to remove an attachment without having to save the page first.
fields.summary: Cannot remove attachments from unsaved page once they are attached

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29899].
  {panel}

When writing texts using the wiki which might contain issue references, the Wiki page editor automatically creates a hyperlink for issues. 
For example, in the sentence "Save the Instruction Script as ABC-123.txt", the ABC-123.txt becomes a hyperlink to the issue, which is not what should happen.

As the wiki markup {no-link} doesn't work anymore, there is no way to turn automatic links off.

Make to user choose if the link should or not be created by "unlinking" the text.

See related issue: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-33888
fields.summary: Make possible to unlink automatic ondemand links in Wiki pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29898].
  {panel}

h3. ***Current Behavior***
If a user imports a personal space using the Confluence OnDemand space importer, that space will become global.

h3. ***Workaround***
 The workaround is to create a new personal space and move the imported content to the new space.

*(!) NOTE: If the user name is the same on the source instance and destination instance you will not be able to create a new personal space on the destination instance as after the import a space with that space key already exists*

If this is the case, follow the documented fix here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+convert+a+global+space+to+a+personal+space+type+in+Confluence

Cloud Customers will need to file a support request at https://support.atlassian.com as the fix requires database access
fields.summary: Confluence Space Importer Converts Personal Spaces to Global on Import
Image gets distorted when selecting image effect.
When exporting to PDF I would like the image effects to be exported as well.
Create a time stamp gadget for pdf exports
Default heading row in wiki tables means extra steps if you don't want it. Add an "add heading row" button to the edit bar and default to no heading.

Taylor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29859].
  {panel}

It creates the page in the root of the space, regardless of what page you are on when you click the button. In previous versions, if you put a Create from Template macro on a page, and clicked it from that page, it would create a child page from the macro. This no longer works in 5.1.4.


*Temporary workarounds:*

*WA 1*. After clicking the 'Create from Template' button, manually change the location.
* For custom templates, like any new page, the location can be changed by clicking the Location button at the bottom of the page.

*WA 2*. Manually create a link to replace the button.
Only for custom templates _(hoover over the button and you should see 'templateId' variable in numbers)_
* Copy Link provided by the 'Create Template Button'.
!Workaround_step1.jpeg|thumbnail!
* Edit page where the button is at.
* Create a new Web Link
* paste the link and add {{&fromPageId=PAGEID}} (where PAGEID is the 'pageId' number shown shown in your browser address bar) !Workaround_step2.jpeg|thumbnail!
* insert, save and test

h2. Solution
The recommended solution is to upgrade to Confluence 5.2.3 when that is released. If for some reason that is not possible, you can manually install a fixed version of the plugin via the add-on administration page:
* For those of you that are unable to upgrade from 5.1.4, [download this version|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/97522/97522_confluence-create-content-plugin-1.5.25.1.obr].
* For those of you currently running Confluence 5.2.1, [download this version|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/98979/98979_confluence-create-content-plugin-1.5.36.obr].
fields.summary: 'Create from Template' Macro No Longer Creates Child Pages
User list macro should not have the 'online/offline' options in OnDemand
Convert collapsed space shortcuts and child navigation buttons to ADG subtle buttons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29854].
  {panel}

A Confluence admin can configure the maximum attachment size in the general configuration screen in the admin console.

Right now, this is in bytes:

!http://cl.ly/image/3w3H34172A3P/Image%202013.07.05%2012%3A54%3A53%20PM.png!

This actually makes it really hard as the average user just wants to do this in Megabytes, not bytes. So you have to do a calculation to work out how many megabytes.

We should simply change to to be Megabytes. Even the error messages we display when someone goes over the limit is in megabytes, not bytes.
fields.summary: Make attachment storage configuration easier to setup by switching it to megabytes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29853].
  {panel}

I set up JIRA
I set up Confluence
When I go to the merge it synchronized properly
I get the following display:


Full synchronisation completed successfully.
Local administrator account created.
We have created a local administrator with the same username and password as the JIRA system administrator you provided. This will ensure that you can always log into Confluence to update the system configuration.

After this the next button does not work so I can not finish the installation.
fields.summary: Setup does not continue past JIRA merge

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29852].
  {panel}

When adding a link to an emoticon, the notion of the link disappears in the editor.
The link works, but cannot be changed anymore like regular links.

To replicate the issue:
 a) Click Insert > Emoticon > Checkmark
 b) highlight the emoticon, click Insert > Link > target
 c) This results in the emoticon on the page with the link to the target.

The editor does not show the "Goto link / edit / unlink" dialog on the emoticon, even though the link is there.
fields.summary: Unable to edit link on emoticon

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29827].
  {panel}

A Confluence space with anonymous permissions enabled does not automatically display content when using the quick-search bar.

*Current Behaviour:*

*Expected Behaviour:*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29822].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to replicate (Global look and feel)
# Click *Space Tools > Overview*.
# The error below is displayed.

h4. Steps to replicate (Documentation Theme)
# Click *Browse > Space Operations*.
# The error below is displayed.

h4. Error
{noformat}
System Error
Cause
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getSpaceAdmins' in class com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.actions.ViewSpaceSummaryAction threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at spaces/viewspacedetails.vm[line 36, column 53]
    at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:223)
caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.DefaultSpaceManager$UserComparator.compare(DefaultSpaceManager.java:688)
{noformat}

h4. Workaround
The error is caused by a group or individual user not being found in the space permissions page, possibly after having imported the space into the instance, or deleted a group/user. To workaround that, go to the space's permissions page and remove any 'not found' group or user.
* https://<your_domain>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/spacepermissions.action?key=<space_key>
fields.summary: Space Operations/Overview link throws error when Space Admins are not found

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29821].
  {panel}

Page overwrite warning message is not appearing when changes made over different network.

Steps to reproduce:
# Have 2 users editing a page from 2 different network
# Both users do something in the edit mode
# 1 of the user save the change made
# The other user save later and no warning message will appear

Expected behavior would appear as the second user will overwrite the first user who made a change.

This doesn't occur within the same network.
fields.summary: Page overwrite warning message is not appearing when changes made over different network

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29818].
  {panel}

Would it be possible to extend the same functionality used by [pagetitle] links to {include:pagetitle} macros?  Can {include:pagetitle} macros be treated like [pagetitle] links?

Links such as [pagetitle] automatically change when the page title changes (is renamed).  For example, lets say that I have a page named "Grape" and a link to [Grape] on the "Food" page and then I rename page "Grape" to "Raisin" then the link on the "Food" page would automatically become [Raisin].  In other words links are renamed or follow when the page they reference is renamed.

When I check the "History" tab I on the "Food" page I see "Grape" as an "Outgoing Link".  When I check the "History" tab on the "Grape" page I see "Food" as an "Incomming Link".

The problem is that when I have an {include:Grape} macro and then rename page "Grape" to "Raisin" my {include:Grape} does not change to {include:Raisin} and essentially becomes a broken reference.

{include:pagetitle} macros do not appear in the "Outgoing Links" section or the "Incomming Links" section.  I wish that they would.
fields.summary: Handle {include:pagetitle} macro references like [pagetitle] link references
Sort table row in Edit Mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29815].
  {panel}

Considering a setup:

browser -- reverse proxy -- confluence server

Whereas the confluence server has an internal hostname, say confluence.internal.example.com and the reverse proxy presents a different one to the browser, say confluence.external.example.com.  The reverse proxy will translate the internal/external hostnames in HTTP Headers and Payload.

Steps to reproduce
Set BASE URL to the external hostname, edit wiki page, insert link, save wikipage.  The links inside the wikipage will be broken (xhtml shows <ac:link/>).

Workaround:
use internal hostname ;)  But since i dont know which tasks inside confluence need the BASE URL i cant tell wether this is actually making sense.  https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF51/Configuring+the+Server+Base+URL is a bit unclear about how that would help in the particular case, or what the individual mentioned features would actually achieve.

I believe that when saving the wiki page confluence checks wether the url is actually valid (regex match against BASE URL?) and invalidates the link if it is not.

Fix
i would propose to, additionally to set a BASE URL, allow for Server-Alias Names which are considered to be the "same-Confluence" Instance and thus links to the server alias names are either accepted plain or internally rewritten to the BASE URL when saving Wiki pages
fields.summary: confluence BASE URL may break proxy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29812].
  {panel}

Currently, if there is a substantial amount of blog posts, then the blog post listing that is on the right side of the page would extend to suit the amount of blog posts that are available. 

This can cause inconveniences if a user would just like to comment or 'like' the blog post that he/she is reading, as they would have to scroll all the way down to the bottom of the list of blogs :

!Confluence blog.png|thumbnail!

It would be better if there was a scrollbar of some sort for the blog listings, so that this situation can be avoided

!before.png!

The database configuration needs to be updated in step 3 of page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+For+MySQL#DatabaseSetupForMySQL-Step3.ConfigureMySQLServer

In the comments, the tx_isolation level is much discussed but this is not mentioned in the setup steps. Request to add:

fields.summary: Documentation upgrade - Confluence mysql database configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29799].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a page
# Capture a screenshot or a smaller image to clipboard
# Paste it into the editor

*Expected behavior*
As like in Chrome it should add the image as attachment and display when saving the page.

*Actual behavior*
Image is show in the editor, but once saving the page it will display as 'Broken image'

Reproduced on Ubuntu with Firefox 22.x as well as in a Windows 7 VirtualBox too. With Firefox 19.x it worked fine.

*Workaround*
- Save the copied image to a file first using any image editor and attach the image from a file instead from the clipboard.
- Downgrade to Firefox 21: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/install-older-version-of-firefox
fields.summary: Paste images into the editor from clipboard using Firefox 22.x and above does not work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29796].
  {panel}

See [Atlassian Answers Content By Label discussion|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/125087/content-by-label-required-labels-and-the-and-or-operator].

OR logic between labels makes sense as long as you don't have any required labels, i.e. it will return pages that have at least one of the labels specified.  However, once you add a required label (+label), the other non-required labels become optional and the results include pages with just the required label.  The required label should be applied *in addition* to the other labels listed in the configuration.

Operator: OR (default)

*Configuration*: aa,bb
*Results*: Returns pages labeled with aa, bb, aa/bb

*Configuration*: aa,bb,+cc
*Results*: Returns pages labeled with aa/cc, bb/cc, aa/bb/cc, and cc (<-- this, pages with just cc, is the problem)
fields.summary: Content by label logic is flawed when using a required label
Attachment macro in a comment disables comment box
Ability to automatically escape emoticon rendering in Word import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29786].
  {panel}

*Request Background*

The new feature names [file list|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/File+List+Blueprint] act as a different type of page.

Hence as default, when created Confluence will automatically create a parent page named "File List" and list all File List pages under it. User may want File List to be created as a child page as they like the hierarchical order of Confluence content.

In order to achieve this, they could move file list pages accordingly. However they need to do it every time they created a new file list page.

*Possible Implementation*

Provide Confluence administrators the option to allow users to create File List as child page automatically.
fields.summary: Allow File List to be Created as Child Page
Option to Turn ON/OFF Text Wrapping in the Code Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29783].
  {panel}

in CF4.x there was a feature to choose a page (including a page browser) to detect the page where to move the attachment to (see screenshot 1). This feature is missing in CF5.x. (see screenhot 2) Hence its hardly possible to move an attachment to a specific page.

Is there a reason why this handy feature was removed?
Is there ny chance to get the choose page feature back?

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Move Attachment: choose page feature got lost in CF5.x

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29768].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Import a space from Confluence where user who originally created the space (and thus is an administrator of it) doesn't exist anymore.
# Try to delete the space.

You'll receive the following stack trace and the space is unable to be deleted:

{noformat}
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getSpaceAdmins' in  class com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.actions.ViewSpaceSummaryAction threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at spaces/viewspacedetails.vm[line 36, column 53]
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:223)
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:262)
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.value(ASTReference.java:507)
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTExpression.value(ASTExpression.java:71)
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTSetDirective.render(ASTSetDirective.java:142)
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:336)
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.Parse.render(Parse.java:263)
      at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.velocity.ProfilingParseDirective.render(ProfilingParseDirective.java:24)
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:175)
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:336)

h3. Workaround
Go into Space Permissions for that space and remove any individual users who have administrator permissions that don't exist anymore. The space is then able to be deleted.
fields.summary: NullPointerException when trying to delete a space if space administrator user doesn't exist
Ability to indent macros (panels, code blocks, etc)
Allow add more sections on Page Layout
Confluence emails should use tiny links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29763].
  {panel}

Creating a template in Confluence with multiple (different) variables will cause only the first value to actually be passed onto the edit page.

*Steps to recreate*
# Create a new template
# Create a table with 3 variables
# Set the following three properties: First variable is simple, Second as Multi Line, Third as List
# Save the template
# Create a new page using your new template
# Enter values for each box (make sure you select an option other than the first one for the dropdown box)
# Click Next

*Result*
Edit mode shows the table with only the first values entered, Everything else will be empty (or default to the first option for the dropdown box)
*Expected Result*
All values passed properly.

Note that having for example three simple text boxes does work properly.

This does not occur in 5.1-OD-9, but does happen in 5.1-OD-13 and 5.1.4 BTF.
fields.summary: Template variable values are lost going into Edit Mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29761].
  {panel}

We would like the ability to set the default notify watchers setting on/off globally, to reduce the number of emails regarding multiple minor edits to pages site wide.
My site is currently undergoing some growing pains and inevitably page content will be edited multiple times before the creator is happy with their creation. This means that any watchers of that page would get multiple email notifications about these edits. (granted unchecking a box isn't rocket science, but it's all about key clicks...)
Would it be possible to implement this feature in the future?
Thanks
fields.summary: Have the ability to switch the notify watchers setting to off globally
Allow Admin to make a custom page template the default for creating pages
Show only Confluence_user members in People Directory
Add the ability to filter by 'template' on content macros

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29750].
  {panel}

Hey,

it would be nice if i can define the default field for the sort order in the summary. By default the summary will be sorted by "title".

Kind regards,

Rene
fields.summary: Default sort order for metadata summary
Adjustable Confluence HeartBeat interval

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29747].
  {panel}

h5. Scenario
When you access Confluence on the base URL (http://something.com/confluence) you will first get redirected to http://something.com/confluence/homepage.action to determine the home page setting, based on which you will be redirected to the homepage set at *Confluence Admin > General Configuration*. This is 2 redirects just by accessing the base URL.

Google in some cases drops out such sites from search indexing, since they have too many redirects and this is very problematic in the case when Confluence is used as public facing Wiki and the homepage itself would be the entry link from where Google would proceed crawling through the links.

The solution would be to eliminate any redirects when accessing the site without login.
fields.summary: Avoid redirection on public access (Confluence facing public)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29746].
  {panel}

I'm using fitbit API to sync User Profile info.

I have checked with couple of users that when they have set weight as 0 in the profile section in any of unit(lbs/kg/stone), The API is not returning me as 0.

API returns value as 62 or 137 with en_US format.

I have attached Screenshots for the same.
fields.summary: Get User Profile API: Weight is not coming as 0 when it is set user by user in profile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29739].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create a table with 2 lines and 4 columns
2) In the first line of the tables, you can write in each column: Name of the Client, Address, Phone and Comment.
3) Then fill the second row of the second column with random characters.
4) The table will grow to the right, which is expeted.
5) When it reaches the size of the page, instead of growing more to the right, it will create a blank line in the first row.

Screenshots attached for more detail.
fields.summary: First row been changed when the second row is increased

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29737].
  {panel}

Hi Team,

There is a bug that can be annoying some customers.

When we add images on Confluence and want to display those images using a Gallery macro filtering them by their labels, the system is behaving differently than to what is stated in the documentation ([Gallery Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Gallery+Macro]).

The parameter *Include Images with these Labels Only* is using "OR" instead of "AND".

EX:
 Image 1, Labels:"atlassian","confluence"
 Image 2, Labels:"confluence", "gallery"
 Image 3, Labels:"gallery","macro"

If we create a gallery specifying the labels to include as "confluence","gallery" we will get Image 1, 2, and 3 as opposed to only getting Image 2.
fields.summary: Gallery Macro Labels Using OR instead of AND
Ability to make changes to documents Live
Option to delete attachments on create page screen
Enable BaseAttachmentContentExtractor DEBUG logging to find out which Document is being indexed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29729].
  {panel}

From testing https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-29680

I tested the plugin with some more sample pdf's which included various unicode characters.

The out come wasn't a system crash like the above issue, but it did not render the pdf, and just displaying a blank document.

Confluence Version: 5.1.2
Office Connector Version: 3.02 & 3.0.11

Attached are the sample pdf's.

To Replicate:

Attach these files to a confluence page
go and edit the page
select 'PDF' Macro
Select pdf to render, select 'refresh'
fields.summary: Confluence PDF-Renderer does not display some unicode characters
Improve remote API access rules adding the possibility to restrict it to a certain user group.
Include the ability to add comments to attachments while adding those by Drag and Drop.
Allow user to decide the inheritance of Permission from Parent Page to Child Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29709].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Use either Confluence 5.1-OD-9 or 5.1-OD-13 (fireball 226 or 230) to create a blog post in a space (personal or not).
# Edit the page and select "Page Restrictions".

The Page Restrictions dialog is blank:

!Screen Shot 2013-06-24 at 13.28.08 .png!

Note: This occurs when quick-editing a blog. If you reload and do a "full-edit" then the button disappears.

This is due to a bug in the EditOrCreatePageCondition, which explicitly includes quick-edit but does not correctly exclude quick-edit of blogposts.
fields.summary: Remove restrictions button from blog posts
Ability for non-admins to view members of a group
As an administrator, I'd like to be able to list and remove plugins using the Remote API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29702].
  {panel}

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add a task to the page
# Check the task as completed
# Save the Page
# Print from the browser

h3.Observation:
If the page looks like this:
!tasks2.jpg!

The printed page looks like this:
!tasks.jpg!

(Missing checkboxes for the tasks)
fields.summary: Task checkboxes are not printed (Printing from Chrome, IE, Firefox)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29700].
  {panel}

As confirmed in issue JST-67733, there is no way to disable displaying the "Child Pages" list in OnDemand.

For us, this is a major disturbance. It means that every page with lots of subpages is very cluttered and the comment section of that page is virtually unusable, since you'd first have to scroll for half a year before getting down there.

It seems odd that in a wiki where I can create templates and adjust the look and feel there is one element to each and every page I create that I can not influence at all. Please add a UI setting to disable Child Pages display for all pages (or a setting for each page with a global default setting).

Thanks
fields.summary: Disaply display of "Child Pages"
